channel.title: NPR Programs: All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Shooting at Brown University kills two, others injured, says Mayor of Providence
item.description: Mayor Brett Smiley of Providence, Rhode Island says two people are dead and multiple people hurt after a shooting at Brown University.
item.content:encoded: Mayor Brett Smiley of Providence, Rhode Island says two people are dead and multiple people hurt after a shooting at Brown University.
item.dc:creator: Miles Parks

item.title: Former Republican congressman on why it's so hard to get bipartisan consensus on healthcare
item.description: Fred Upton, a former Republican congressman from Michigan, discusses the Senate's failed health care votes and the political fallout of rising insurance premiums.
item.content:encoded: Fred Upton, a former Republican congressman from Michigan, discusses the Senate's failed health care votes and the political fallout of rising insurance premiums.
item.dc:creator: Avery Keatley

item.title: A critic's guide to the year's most cringe-worthy watches
item.description: Joanna Robinson, a cultural critic at The Ringer, examines what made this year's most talked about flops so bad.
item.content:encoded: Joanna Robinson, a cultural critic at The Ringer, examines what made this year's most talked about flops so bad.
item.dc:creator: Gurjit Kaur

item.title: Birth mothers call for more government support
item.description: There are more federal tax cuts in the works for people who adopt children. Birth mothers say they also want financial support so they don't have to place their infants up for adoption.
item.content:encoded: There are more federal tax cuts in the works for people who adopt children. Birth mothers say they also want financial support so they don't have to place their infants up for adoption.
item.dc:creator: T.J. Raphael

item.title: Response to NPR's investigation into companies charging vets for free benefits
item.description: NPR's Chris Arnold and Leah Rosenbaum of The War Horse discuss an NPR investigation into companies charging disabled veterans thousands of dollars for help the Department of Veterans Affairs says should be free and what the response from Congress has been.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Chris Arnold and Leah Rosenbaum of The War Horse discuss an NPR investigation into companies charging disabled veterans thousands of dollars for help the Department of Veterans Affairs says should be free and what the response from Congress has been.
item.dc:creator: Chris Arnold

item.title: Back-to-back storms push Washington rivers past their limits
item.description: John Ryan, KUOW environment reporter, describes how a series of powerful storms overwhelmed Washington's rivers and communities.
item.content:encoded: John Ryan, KUOW environment reporter, describes how a series of powerful storms overwhelmed Washington's rivers and communities.
item.dc:creator: John Ryan

item.title: Riding the train in Rio that tells the story of samba
item.description: Step aboard the Samba Train, where music, history, and resistance roll together through the streets of Rio.
item.content:encoded: Step aboard the Samba Train, where music, history, and resistance roll together through the streets of Rio.
item.dc:creator: JÃºlia Dias Carneiro

item.title: How a U.S. citizen lost his voter registration to a federal database error
item.description: A U.S. citizen in Texas lost his voter registration after a federal screening system wrongly labeled him a noncitizen.
item.content:encoded: A U.S. citizen in Texas lost his voter registration after a federal screening system wrongly labeled him a noncitizen.
item.dc:creator: Miles Parks

item.title: Maria Corina Machado's daughter reflects on her mother's future
item.description: Ana Corina Sosa, daughter of Venezuelan opposition leader Maria Corina Machado, reflects on her mother's escape from Venezuela and the stakes for the future.
item.content:encoded: Ana Corina Sosa, daughter of Venezuelan opposition leader Maria Corina Machado, reflects on her mother's escape from Venezuela and the stakes for the future.
item.dc:creator: Sarah Robbins

item.title: For the first time in 35 years, NPR's Hanukkah Lights will be without Susan Stamberg
item.description: This is the first Hanukkah that Murray Horwitz will not be joined by the late Susan Stamberg on NPR's holiday special Hanukkah Lights. We talk with him about their 35 years of making the show.
item.content:encoded: This is the first Hanukkah that Murray Horwitz will not be joined by the late Susan Stamberg on NPR's holiday special Hanukkah Lights. We talk with him about their 35 years of making the show.
item.dc:creator: Murray Horwitz
